benchmark_details.name: MIntRec-1 (Multimodal Intent Recognition - Version 1)
benchmark_details.overview: The benchmark focuses on multimodal intent detection, analyzing the performance of Large Language Models and their ability to handle modality biases. It introduces a debiasing framework designed to validate and optimize existing datasets for better performance evaluation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To study modality bias in multimodal intent detection and to propose a framework for debiasing multimodal intent datasets.

data.source: Two publicly available benchmark multimodal intent detection datasets: MIntRec-1 and MIntRec2.0.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions made by models during the evaluation of intent detection tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in accuracy and F1 score indicate better performance in detecting intents accurately across modalities.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation techniques were employed to ensure reliability of the evaluation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The datasets used do not contain personally sensitive information.
